intro.p: With total gun-related deaths reaching new highs in recent years, growing shares of Americans view both gun violence and violent crime as very big national problems.
In June 2023, the Pew Research Center sent a survey out to {{n}} U.S. adults. A total of {{s}} adults responded. {{x}} adults favor increasing the minimum age for buying guns to 21 years old.

Compute a {{CL}}\% confidence interval for the proportion of {{prose}}. You may use an app to do the computations. You must show all your computations and/or a screenshot of any app used. Please use your work answer the following.

content.p: What is p-hat? Please give your answer exact to three decimal places.
What is the standard error for this interval? Please give your answer exact to four decimal places.
What is the confidence interval? Please give your answer in proper interval format exact to four decimal places.
Put the resulting interval into context to answer the following question: What percentage of U.S. adults believe the minimum age for buying a gun should be rasied to 21 years old

outtro.p: With {{CL}}\% confidence level, the proportion of U.S. adults that believe the minimum age for buying a gun should be raised to 21 years old is between {{LB_p}}\% and {{UB_p}}\%.
